content.query:
DROP TABLE andy.Customer
DROP TABLE andy.Product
DROP TABLE andy.stores
DROP TABLE andy.TransactionDetail
DROP TABLE andy.TransactionHeader
DROP SCHEMA andy
GO

CREATE SCHEMA andy
GO

CREATE TABLE andy.Customer
	(
	 [Name] nvarchar(4000),
	 [Address] nvarchar(4000),
	 [City] nvarchar(4000),
	 [State] nvarchar(4000),
	 [PostalCode] bigint,
	 [Country] nvarchar(4000),
	 [PreferredStore] nvarchar(4000),
	 [RewardsPoints] bigint,
	 [CustomerRetailID] uniqueidentifier,
	 [img] nvarchar(4000),
	 [EmailId] nvarchar(4000)
	)
WITH
	(
	DISTRIBUTION = REPLICATE,
	 HEAP
	 -- CLUSTERED COLUMNSTORE INDEX
	)
GO


CREATE TABLE andy.Product
	(
	 [Name] nvarchar(4000),
	 [Cost] float,
	 [ListPrice] float,
	 [RetailProductID] uniqueidentifier
	)
WITH
	(
	DISTRIBUTION = REPLICATE,
	HEAP
	)
GO


CREATE TABLE andy.stores
	(
	 [StoreCode] bigint,
	 [Name] nvarchar(4000),
	 [Address] nvarchar(4000),
	 [City] nvarchar(4000),
	 [State] nvarchar(4000),
	 [PostalCode] bigint,
	 [Country] nvarchar(4000),
	 [Area] bigint,
	 [NumberofEmployees] bigint,
	 [StoreRetailID] uniqueidentifier,
	 [PhoneNumber] nvarchar(4000),
	 [Website] nvarchar(4000)
	)
WITH
	(
	DISTRIBUTION = replicate,
	 HEAP
	 -- CLUSTERED COLUMNSTORE INDEX
	)
GO

CREATE TABLE andy.TransactionDetail
	(
	 [CustomerRetailID] uniqueidentifier,
	 [TransactionHeaderID] uniqueidentifier,
	 [ProductRetailID] uniqueidentifier,
	 [Quantity] bigint,
	 [ListPrice] float,
	 [DiscountAmount] float,
	 [Tax] float,
	 [ShippingCost] float,
	 [TotalAmount] float
	)
WITH
	(
	DISTRIBUTION = HASH(TransactionHeaderID),
	 CLUSTERED COLUMNSTORE INDEX
	 -- HEAP
	)
GO


CREATE TABLE andy.TransactionHeader
	(
	 [TransactionHeaderID] uniqueidentifier,
	 [StoreRetailID] uniqueidentifier,
	 [CustomerRetailID] uniqueidentifier,
	 [Title] nvarchar(4000),
	 [Description] nvarchar(4000),
	 [Date] datetime2(0),
	 [TransactionType] nvarchar(4000),
	 [TransactionTotal] float,
	 [PaymentMethod] nvarchar(4000),
	 [Currency] nvarchar(4000)
	)
WITH
	(
	DISTRIBUTION = HASH(TransactionHeaderID),
	 CLUSTERED COLUMNSTORE INDEX
	 -- HEAP
	)
GO

select top 100 *
from
    openrowset(
        bulk 'https://andyrobretailstor.dfs.core.windows.net/datalake/andyrob/raw/RetailCustomer.csv'
        , format = 'CSV'
        , parser_version ='2.0'
        , header_row = true
    ) as customers

select state
        , city
        , customercount = count(*) 
from
    openrowset(
        bulk 'https://andyrobretailstor.dfs.core.windows.net/datalake/andyrob/raw/RetailCustomer.csv'
        , format = 'CSV'
        , parser_version ='2.0'
        , header_row = true
    ) as customers
group by state, city
order by customercount DESC


select top 100 *
  from
    openrowset(
        bulk  'https://andyrobretailstor.dfs.core.windows.net/datalake/andyrob/raw/RetailTransactionDetails.csv'
        , format = 'CSV'
        , parser_version ='2.0'
        , header_row = true
    ) as orderdetails


select count(*)
  from 
      openrowset(
        bulk  'https://andyrobretailstor.dfs.core.windows.net/datalake/andyrob/raw/RetailTransactionDetails.csv'
        , format = 'CSV'
        , parser_version ='2.0'
        , header_row = true
    ) as orderdetails

--CREATE SCHEMA andy


IF EXISTS (SELECT * FROM sys.objects O JOIN sys.schemas S ON O.schema_id = S.schema_id WHERE O.NAME = 'customer' AND O.TYPE = 'U' AND S.NAME = 'andy')
DROP TABLE andy.Customer

CREATE TABLE andy.Customer
	(
	 [Name] nvarchar(4000),
	 [Address] nvarchar(4000),
	 [City] nvarchar(4000),
	 [State] nvarchar(4000),
	 [PostalCode] bigint,
	 [Country] nvarchar(4000),
	 [PreferredStore] nvarchar(4000),
	 [RewardsPoints] bigint,
	 [CustomerRetailID] uniqueidentifier,
	 [img] nvarchar(4000),
	 [EmailId] nvarchar(4000)
	)
WITH
	(
	DISTRIBUTION = REPLICATE,
	 HEAP
	 -- CLUSTERED COLUMNSTORE INDEX
	)
GO

--Uncomment the 4 lines below to create a stored procedure for data pipeline orchestration​
--CREATE PROC andy.bulk_load_customer
--AS
--BEGIN
COPY INTO andy.Customer
(Name 1, Address 2, City 3, State 4, PostalCode 5, Country 6, PreferredStore 7, RewardsPoints 8, CustomerRetailID 9, img 10, EmailId 11)
FROM 'https://andyrobretailstor.dfs.core.windows.net/datalake/andyrob/raw/RetailCustomer.csv'
WITH
(
	FILE_TYPE = 'CSV'
	,MAXERRORS = 0
	,FIRSTROW = 2
	,ERRORFILE = 'https://andyrobretailstor.dfs.core.windows.net/datalake/'
	,IDENTITY_INSERT = 'OFF'
)
--END
GO

SELECT TOP 100 * FROM andy.Customer
GO

IF NOT EXISTS (SELECT * FROM sys.objects O JOIN sys.schemas S ON O.schema_id = S.schema_id WHERE O.NAME = 'Product' AND O.TYPE = 'U' AND S.NAME = 'andy')
CREATE TABLE andy.Product
	(
	 [Name] nvarchar(4000),
	 [Cost] float,
	 [ListPrice] float,
	 [RetailProductID] uniqueidentifier
	)
WITH
	(
	DISTRIBUTION = REPLICATE,
	HEAP
	)
GO

--Uncomment the 4 lines below to create a stored procedure for data pipeline orchestration​
--CREATE PROC bulk_load_Product
--AS
--BEGIN
COPY INTO andy.Product
(Name 1, Cost 2, ListPrice 3, RetailProductID 4)
FROM 'https://andyrobretailstor.dfs.core.windows.net/datalake/andyrob/raw/RetailProducts.csv'
WITH
(
	FILE_TYPE = 'CSV'
	,MAXERRORS = 0
	,FIRSTROW = 2
	,ERRORFILE = 'https://andyrobretailstor.dfs.core.windows.net/datalake/'
	,IDENTITY_INSERT = 'OFF'
)
--END
GO

SELECT TOP 100 * FROM andy.Product
GO

IF NOT EXISTS (SELECT * FROM sys.objects O JOIN sys.schemas S ON O.schema_id = S.schema_id WHERE O.NAME = 'stores' AND O.TYPE = 'U' AND S.NAME = 'andy')
CREATE TABLE andy.stores
	(
	 [StoreCode] bigint,
	 [Name] nvarchar(4000),
	 [Address] nvarchar(4000),
	 [City] nvarchar(4000),
	 [State] nvarchar(4000),
	 [PostalCode] bigint,
	 [Country] nvarchar(4000),
	 [Area] bigint,
	 [NumberofEmployees] bigint,
	 [StoreRetailID] uniqueidentifier,
	 [PhoneNumber] nvarchar(4000),
	 [Website] nvarchar(4000)
	)
WITH
	(
	DISTRIBUTION = replicate,
	 HEAP
	 -- CLUSTERED COLUMNSTORE INDEX
	)
GO

--Uncomment the 4 lines below to create a stored procedure for data pipeline orchestration​
--CREATE PROC bulk_load_stores
--AS
--BEGIN
COPY INTO andy.stores
(StoreCode 1, Name 2, Address 3, City 4, State 5, PostalCode 6, Country 7, Area 8, NumberofEmployees 9, StoreRetailID 10, PhoneNumber 11, Website 12)
FROM 'https://andyrobretailstor.dfs.core.windows.net/datalake/andyrob/raw/RetailStores.csv'
WITH
(
	FILE_TYPE = 'CSV'
	,MAXERRORS = 0
	,FIRSTROW = 2
	,ERRORFILE = 'https://andyrobretailstor.dfs.core.windows.net/datalake/'
	,IDENTITY_INSERT = 'OFF'
)
--END
GO

SELECT TOP 100 * FROM andy.stores
GO

-- DROP TABLE andy.TransactionDetail

IF NOT EXISTS (SELECT * FROM sys.objects O JOIN sys.schemas S ON O.schema_id = S.schema_id WHERE O.NAME = 'TransactionDetail' AND O.TYPE = 'U' AND S.NAME = 'andy')
CREATE TABLE andy.TransactionDetail
	(
	 [CustomerRetailID] uniqueidentifier,
	 [TransactionHeaderID] uniqueidentifier,
	 [ProductRetailID] uniqueidentifier,
	 [Quantity] bigint,
	 [ListPrice] float,
	 [DiscountAmount] float,
	 [Tax] float,
	 [ShippingCost] float,
	 [TotalAmount] float
	)
WITH
	(
	DISTRIBUTION = HASH(TransactionHeaderID),
	 CLUSTERED COLUMNSTORE INDEX
	 -- HEAP
	)
GO

--Uncomment the 4 lines below to create a stored procedure for data pipeline orchestration​
--CREATE PROC bulk_load_TransactionDetail
--AS
--BEGIN
COPY INTO andy.TransactionDetail
(CustomerRetailID 1, TransactionHeaderID 2, ProductRetailID 3, Quantity 4, ListPrice 5, DiscountAmount 6, Tax 7, ShippingCost 8, TotalAmount 9)
FROM 'https://andyrobretailstor.dfs.core.windows.net/datalake/andyrob/raw/RetailTransactionDetails.csv'
WITH
(
	FILE_TYPE = 'CSV'
	,MAXERRORS = 0
	,FIRSTROW = 2
	,ERRORFILE = 'https://andyrobretailstor.dfs.core.windows.net/datalake/'
	,IDENTITY_INSERT = 'OFF'
)
--END
GO

SELECT TOP 100 * FROM andy.TransactionDetail
GO

DBCC PDW_SHOWSPACEUSED('andy.TransactionDetail');

IF NOT EXISTS (SELECT * FROM sys.objects O JOIN sys.schemas S ON O.schema_id = S.schema_id WHERE O.NAME = 'TransactionHeader' AND O.TYPE = 'U' AND S.NAME = 'andy')
CREATE TABLE andy.TransactionHeader
	(
	 [TransactionHeaderID] uniqueidentifier,
	 [StoreRetailID] uniqueidentifier,
	 [CustomerRetailID] uniqueidentifier,
	 [Title] nvarchar(4000),
	 [Description] nvarchar(4000),
	 [Date] datetime2(0),
	 [TransactionType] nvarchar(4000),
	 [TransactionTotal] float,
	 [PaymentMethod] nvarchar(4000),
	 [Currency] nvarchar(4000)
	)
WITH
	(
	DISTRIBUTION = HASH(TransactionHeaderID),
	 CLUSTERED COLUMNSTORE INDEX
	 -- HEAP
	)
GO

--Uncomment the 4 lines below to create a stored procedure for data pipeline orchestration​
--CREATE PROC bulk_load_TransactionHeader
--AS
--BEGIN
COPY INTO andy.TransactionHeader
(TransactionHeaderID 1, StoreRetailID 2, CustomerRetailID 3, Title 4, Description 5, Date 6, TransactionType 7, TransactionTotal 8, PaymentMethod 9, Currency 10)
FROM 'https://andyrobretailstor.dfs.core.windows.net/datalake/andyrob/raw/RetailTransactionHeader.csv'
WITH
(
	FILE_TYPE = 'CSV'
	,MAXERRORS = 0
	,FIRSTROW = 2
	,ERRORFILE = 'https://andyrobretailstor.dfs.core.windows.net/datalake/'
	,IDENTITY_INSERT = 'OFF'
)
--END
GO

SELECT TOP 100 * FROM andy.TransactionHeader
GO

DBCC PDW_SHOWSPACEUSED('andy.TransactionHeader');

create database SourceViewsDb

use SourceViewsDb

create view vTransactionDetails 
as
select * 
  from 
    openrowset(
        bulk  'https://andyrobretailstor.dfs.core.windows.net/datalake/andyrob/raw/RetailTransactionDetails.csv'
        , format = 'CSV'
        , parser_version ='2.0'
        , header_row = true
    ) txndetails
GO

create view vTransactionHeader
as
select * 
  from 
    openrowset(
        bulk  'https://andyrobretailstor.dfs.core.windows.net/datalake/andyrob/raw/RetailTransactionHeader.csv'
        , format = 'CSV'
        , parser_version ='2.0'
        , header_row = true
    ) txnheader
go

create view vCustomer
as
select * 
  from 
    openrowset(
        bulk  'https://andyrobretailstor.dfs.core.windows.net/datalake/andyrob/raw/RetailCustomer.csv'
        , format = 'CSV'
        , parser_version ='2.0'
        , header_row = true
    ) customer
go

create view vProducts
as
select * 
  from 
    openrowset(
        bulk  'https://andyrobretailstor.dfs.core.windows.net/datalake/andyrob/raw/RetailProducts.csv'
        , format = 'CSV'
        , parser_version ='2.0'
        , header_row = true
    ) products
go

create view vStores
as
select * 
  from 
    openrowset(
        bulk  'https://andyrobretailstor.dfs.core.windows.net/datalake/andyrob/raw/RetailStores.csv'
        , format = 'CSV'
        , parser_version ='2.0'
        , header_row = true
    ) stores
go




select top 10 * from vTransactionDetails
select top 10 * from vTransactionHeader
select top 10 * from vProducts
select top 10 * from vStores
select top 10 * from vCustomer


select top 10
  c.name
  , count(*)
  from vTransactionHeader th 
  join vCustomer c
    on th.CustomerRetailID = c.CustomerRetailID
group by c.name
order by 2 desc
